transportAdvice: Puno's compact city center is walkable for most tourist attractions, though the high altitude (3,800m) makes uphill walks tiring. Tuk-tuks and taxis are widely available for getting around town and reaching the port for Lake Titicaca excursions.

weather.description: Peak rainy season with frequent afternoon and evening downpours; pack waterproof gear.
The wettest month of the year with heavy rainfall and occasional flooding around the lake.
Rain continues to be frequent though intensity begins to ease slightly toward month's end.
Transitional month with decreasing rainfall and clearer skies starting to emerge.
Dry season begins with sunny days, cold nights, and excellent visibility over the lake.
Cold and dry with near-freezing nights; clear skies make for stunning lake and mountain views.
The coldest month with frosty nights but reliably sunny days; peak tourist season.
Still dry and cold at night but days are bright and pleasant for outdoor activities.
Late dry season with warming days and continued clear skies; a great time to visit.
Transitional month as the rainy season approaches; occasional afternoon showers begin.
Rain becomes more frequent with afternoon storms, though mornings are often clear.
Rainy season is well underway with regular heavy showers; the lake begins to rise.
